intro: Draba arabisans var. orthocarpa, commonly known as the narrowleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 5–20 cm. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs, and it thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. This variety is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in alpine and arctic environments.
